  • Method Details

    • markforDelGroup

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) void markforDelGroup(Integer idUser, Integer idReplyToLocal)
      Marks a group of related mail messages (a conversation thread) as deleted for a specific user. This is achieved by inserting new records into the mail_send_recv_read_del table with mark_hide_del = 1, or updating existing ones if they already exist (ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE).

      The SQL query identifies messages belonging to the specified idReplyToLocal (conversation thread ID) that are relevant to the given idUser. This includes:

      1. Messages received by the user as part of a role, considering the user's role membership start time.
      2. Messages directly sent by or received by the user within that conversation thread.
      3. Other messages within the same role-based conversation thread that the user might have visibility to (e.g., public replies in a role discussion, or private replies if the user was the sender of the original role message), again considering role membership start times.
      For all identified messages, a corresponding entry in mail_send_recv_read_del is created or updated to set mark_hide_del = 1 and has_been_read = 0 (as this operation only marks for deletion, not as read).
      Parameters:
      idUser - The ID of the user for whom the message group should be marked as deleted.
      idReplyToLocal - The ID that identifies the conversation thread/group of messages.
